lead_paragraph: An indictment released in New Jersey on Friday filled out specifics of the George Washington Bridge lane-closing scandal, and the delight three conspirators took in it.

headline.print_headline: Bridge Jam Tied to School Start, Indictment Says
headline.main: U.S. Indictment Details Plotting in New Jersey Bridge Scandal

snippet: An indictment released in New Jersey on Friday filled out specifics of the George Washington Bridge lane-closing scandal, and the delight three conspirators took in it.
abstract: Federal prosecutors in New Jersey release indictment that details intricate lengths to which Bill Baroni, Bridget Anne Kelly and David Wildstein, allies of New Jersey Gov Chris Christie, went to plan, carry out and then cover up George Washington Bridge lane closures that paralyzed town of Fort Lee for days; Baroni and Kelly will face charges, and Wildstein has pleaded guilty; Christie says indictments prove he had no hand in incident.
